title: China’s 2023: closing out a busy year amidst preparations for lunar missions
summary: Following China’s impressive 2022, the country once again managed to launch over 60 times in a calendar year. While the year lacked high-profile missions, more are on the horizon as China focuses on the Moon.

title: Axelspace raises $44 million for Earth observation and other smallsats
summary: Japanese Earth observation company Axelspace has raised nearly $44 million to both expand its satellite constellation and provide smallsats for other applications.

title: Spaceports need social scientists. Here’s why.
summary: Engaging social scientists when planning and development spaceports could ensure that they're made in an ethical, community-engaging way.

title: OHB Get Go-Head to Commence €90M ODIN’S EYE II Project
summary:
The European Commission has signed an agreement with OHB System AG to commence work on the €90 million ODIN’S EYE II space-based early warning system for ballistic and hypersonic missiles. The multinatiOnal Development INitiative for a Space-based missilE earlY-warning architecturE (ODIN’S EYE) project was created by the European Commission with the aim of developing a […]

title: ASI Signs Contract for Lunar Robotic Mission Simulation and Control Centre
summary:
The Italian space agency ASI has signed a €3.5 million contract with ALTEC for the initial design and construction phase of the Centro di Simulazione e Controllo Missioni Robotiche Lunari (Lunar Robotic Mission Simulation and Control Center). Located at the ALTEC Turin Aerospace City facilities, the new control center will be completed in three years. […]
The post ASI Signs Contract for Lunar Robotic Mission Simulation and Control Centre appeared first on European Spaceflight.
